body.p: A registered user can schedule a meeting, that is, create a scheduled meeting in the MiTeam Meetings application. To create a scheduled meeting, follow these steps:

li.p: In the Meetings home screen, click Schedule. The Schedule a meeting panel opens.

In the Meeting title bar, specify a title for the meeting. It is highly recommended that a meeting be given a unique humanly identifiable name that is easy to remember for the participants. This will enable registered users to easily identify which meeting space to use for their collaboration and facilitate meeting searches.
Click Calendar and from the drop-down list, choose the calendar to which you want to add the meeting invite.
You can add both registered users and guest users as participants for a meeting.You can add a maximum of 100 participants.
To add registered users to a meeting:
In the Search bar, type the name of the user you are searching for. The search field displays a list of registered users whose names or e-mail addresses match the letters that you type.
Click the name to add the user as a participant to the meeting.
To add a guest user to a meeting:

In the Search bar, type the email address of the participant you want to add to the meeting. Note that you must type the exact e-mail address of the participant you want to add. The e-mail address you type appears in the search field.
Click the e-mail address to add the user as a participant to the meeting.
Click Add to Calendar. The Scheduling proceeds based on the calendar type you selected from the Calendar drop-down list.
Default Calendar (.ics download) – downloads an ICS file with meeting join details, title, and participants that can be opened in your default calendar app (such as Outlook desktop).
Google Calendar – opens a new tab in Gmail with a prepopulated calendar invite with meeting join details, title, and participants.

Exchange / Office 365 – opens a new tab in Office 365 with a prepopulated calendar invite with meeting join details and title; but does not carry over the participants. You must add the participants directly in the open calendar in Office 365.

Outlook.com – opens a new tab in Office 365 with a prepopulated calendar invite with meeting join details and title; but does not carry over the participants. You must add the participants directly in the open calendar in Outlook.com.

ul.li: Customers should exercise caution to prevent accidental disclosure of Meeting Access Codes.
Mitel recommends that at least one participant in a meeting use the Mitel Meetings client to provide visibility to other participants in the meeting.

note.p: For more information, see MiTeam Meetings Security Guidelines.
